summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from February 24, 2025, discussing a request from Senator Blackburn to Director Patel for evidence related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The emails clarify that no documents were seized during Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest, and the only video from Palm Beach is a 2005 police walkthrough. FBI personnel coordinate a response to the Senator's request for flight logs, address books, surveillance footage, and other records.

persons.name: Senator Blackburn
persons.context: Wrote a letter to FBI Director Patel requesting evidence related to the Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell investigation, including flight logs, address books, and surveillance footage.

persons.name: Director Patel
persons.context: Recipient of a letter from Senator Blackburn requesting evidence in the Epstein/Maxwell case; the FBI is preparing a response.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of evidence requests; her arrest is mentioned, and documents in her possession (like an address book) are sought.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the investigation; evidence related to his private jets, helicopters, and Palm Beach residence is requested.

connections.description: Maxwell is associated with Epstein in the investigation; evidence requests target records linking individuals to both of them.
Blackburn is making an official evidence request to the FBI Director regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Palm Beach Police search warrant execution
events.description: Palm Beach Police conducted a search warrant at Jeffrey Epstein's residence; the only video footage from that location is a police walkthrough from this operation.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested; the FBI clarifies that no documents were seized during this arrest.

events.title: Senator Blackburn's letter to FBI Director
events.description: Senator Blackburn writes to FBI Director Patel formally requesting specific evidence related to the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

keyFacts: The FBI confirms no documents were seized during the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell.
The only video footage from Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach residence is a 2005 Palm Beach Police walkthrough video from their search warrant execution.
Senator Blackburn formally requested Epstein's complete flight logs, Maxwell's address book, surveillance footage from the Palm Beach home, and all related documents.
The email chain shows internal FBI coordination to respond to a congressional request for evidence in a high-profile case.
